page.title: 01GAZETTEER OF GILLINGHAM AREA
page.content: {POPULATION:}The only large communities are Gillinghm,approximately 6,000,and Milton,approx.200. {GEOLOGY:}The area lies on Kimmeridge clay with outcrops of sandstone.This explains the abundance of dairy farms The rivers Stour,Lodden and Shreen flow through the area.Gillingham is where the Stour and Shreen meet. {TRANSPORT:}Gillingham has a sparse bus service to Shaftesbury and is on the main Exeter to London railway. {SERVICES:}Gillingham has a police station,a volunteer fire service,a clinic, a library, a citizens'advice bureau and a museum. {LEISURE:}There is a community centre at Gillingham with a heated swimming pool, badminton and squash courts and a licensed bar. {EDUCATION:}Gillingham-primary & secondary comprehensive:Milton-primary
